required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SARS-CoV-2 Transmission in Belgian Primary Schools of the Federation Wallonie - Bruxelles: An Epidemiological Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: SARS-CoV-2 Transmission in Belgian Primary Schools of the Federation Wallonie - Bruxelles: An Epidemiological Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypothesize that children are less likely to become infected in the school environment, compared to the household or outside the school setting. Primary schools do not play a major role in SARS-CoV-2 spreading. They hypothesize that incidence level in schools is mainly a consequence of community transmission. The incidence level in household and that the secondary attack rate in schools remains at least 5 times lower that the transmission level in households.

primary_outcome.measure: Infection of a child with SARS-CoV-2 secondary to a classmate
primary_outcome.description: Time varying number and proportion of children infected with SARS-CoV-2 secondary to an asymptomatic infected classmate (transmission rate inside school with the child being the infector).

primary_outcome.measure: Infection of an adult school-attender with SARS-CoV-2 secondary to an infected child
primary_outcome.description: Time varying number and proportion of adult school-attenders infected with SARS-CoV-2 secondary to an asymptomatic infected child (transmission rate inside school but from a child to an adult).

primary_outcome.measure: Infection of a child with SARS-CoV-2 secondary to an adult school attender
primary_outcome.description: Time varying number and proportion of children infected with SARS-CoV-2 secondary to an infected adult school-attender (transmission rate inside school but from an adult to a child)

primary_outcome.measure: Infection of a child with SARS-CoV-2 secondary to a contact outside the school, including the household
primary_outcome.description: Time varying number and proportion of children infected with SARS-CoV-2 secondary to a household contact or outside the school (transmission rate from in community).

study_pop.textblock:
All Belgian primary schools of the Federation Wallonie - Bruxelles that have organized a full resumption of school activities with the control measures recommended by the government, are eligible for the study.
Twelve schools were chosen by purposive criteria: either high (≥2 classes per grade) or low size of the school, a school within an area with either a high or a low incidence of SARS-CoV-2 during April 2020, the first wave of covid-19 in Belgium, and a school with either a high or a low socioeconomic level (Belgian 20-point-scale ISE idex >14 or <6).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All children and school attenders from selected schools was invited to participate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal to provide written informed consent before enrolment

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
